contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox city Japan |Name= Kuzumaki |JapaneseName= 葛巻町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Kuzumaki in Iwate Prefecture.png |Region= [[Tōhoku region|Tōhoku]] |Prefecture= [[Iwate Prefecture|Iwate]] |District= [[Iwate District, Iwate|Iwate]] |Area_km2= 434.99 |PopDate= 2003 |Population= 8,113 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 40 |LatitudeMinutes= 02 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 141 |LongtitudeMinutes= 26 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= |Flower= |Bird= |Fish= |SymbolImage=Flag of Kuzumaki Iwate.svg |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://www.town.kuzumaki.iwate.jp/ Town of Kuzumaki] }} {{nihongo|'''Kuzumaki'''|葛巻町|Kuzumaki-machi}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Iwate District, Iwate|Iwate District]], [[Iwate Prefecture|Iwate]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 8,113 and a [[population density|density]] of 18.65 persons per km². The total area is 434.99 km². The town uses many alternative energy sources.<ref>Masters, Coco. "[http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1867805,00.html A Japanese Town That Kicked the Oil Habit]." ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''. December 22, 2008. Retrieved on December 25, 2008.</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} *[http://www.town.kuzumaki.iwate.jp/ Kuzumaki official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Towns in Iwate Prefecture]]
